titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Archives of Irish America Manuscript Collection AIA.006
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-08-06T15:27-0400

did.unittitle: Archives of Irish America Manuscript Collection

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: This is an artifical collection created by the Archives of Irish America during its early years of collecting. The collection consists of a variety of materials, including documents concerning 19th century court cases involving the Ancient Order of Hibernians.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Archives of Irish America Collection on the Ancient Order of Hibernians (AIA 046)
Archives of Irish America Photograph Collection (AIA 053)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is an artifical collection created by the Archives of Irish America during its early years of collecting. The collection consists of a variety of materials, including photocopies of Irish immigrant letters and documents concerning 19th century court cases involving the Ancient Order of Hibernians.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: The Archives of Irish America Photograph Collection is an artificial collection created via active collection by staff, contributions from donors and from material removed from collections in the Archives. The provenance for most of the materials in this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1997.024. Folder 4 containing photocopies of Irish emigrant letters from the 19th century had been separated from the David Montgomery Papers (TAM 446) in 2009 and incorporated into this artificial collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Archives of Irish America Manuscript Collection; AIA 006; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain beginning in 2019. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Archives of Irish America, a special collection documenting the the Irish migration experience and American Irish ethnicity in the 20th century, accumulated these materials via active collection by staff, contributions from donors and from material removed from collections in the Archives.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Folder 4 contains photocopies of 19th century Irish emigrant letters housed at the Public Records Office of Northern Ireland.
